basics.name: Eugene Sui Ki Chan
basics.label: Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineer in Toronto, Ontario, Canada
basics.summary:
British and Hong Kong Chinese
Extensive experience in Python for data science, machine learning engineering and data-driven internal business consulting.

work.name: Source One Financial - Toronto, Ontario, Canada
summary: Teamwork and Coaching Coached a sub-team of 2 junior data analysts to manage >100 daily EDWs, ETL RPAs, models and QlikSense dashboards, for operation researches in fraud detection, revenue excellence, CRM partnership, credit and income, funding and booking processes, debt sales, etc.

Data-driven Revenue Planning Spearheaded revenue maximization strategy and negotiation with external CS/Collection partners. Leveraged credit and behavioural metadata to identify potential revenue verticals and successfully reduced ~20% of 31+ days delinquency.
<mark>Internal Consulting</mark> Partnered with C-suits, Sales, Operations, Credit and Finance teams on data project consulting, data-driven decision making and any ad hoc business questions.
highlights: RoBERTa-base keywords & intention identification model for alternative data (call transcripts and text notes), equivalent to 20 man-hours weekly saving.
XGBoost-powered CAD 28M bad debt selling,  along with sell side due-diligence and buy-side relationship management; recorded recovery ~15%.

work.name: Source One Financial - Toronto, Ontario, Canada
work.position: Data Scientist & Interim Data Analytic Manager (Seconded)

work.name: Merck Sharp Dohme (Merck & Co.) - Hong Kong SAR, China
work.position: Pricing and Analytics Specialist, Advanced Analytics
summary: <mark>Architectual Change Management</mark> Co-evolved APAC data ecosystem from data governance, interfacing, ETL, RPAs to pilot prediction algorithms, business intelligence and storytelling, and coordinated data pipeline development with > 200 sales & marketing teammates, regional-level data engineers, external data owners and service providers.
highlights: XGBoost digital segmentation for all customer accounts (>30,000) via SageMaker.

Marketing data (MarTech) ventures on social listening, advertisement placement, cross-channel A/B testing and performance marketing automations on a flagship franchise to bring over 30% YOY growth in Lead.

Greedy learning (XGBoost, SVM and GAM), Epsilon Greedy and Statistics (Thompson Sampling) for cross-functional policy and pricing researches (~ USD YOY 1B revenue generators); pitched up to kick start an experimental pricing initiative supported by DataIku framework and QlikSense dashboards.

work.name: Pfizer - Hong Kong SAR, China
summary: DataStrategy & Change Management Assisted Asia Pacific management to drive a half-year strategy change management via customer analysis and segmentation via XGBoost tree analysis, KPIs and MBOs setting, competitor analysis and idiosyncratic country capability development plans, reshaping work for >2,000 colleagues in 10 Asia countries and reduced ~20% work hours.

<mark>Internal Consulting and Cross-functional Partnership</mark> Led FP&A automation, local analytics, data mining and internal consulting, as an one-year interim Insight Lead and Information Security Officer. Co-led implementation of a cross-market Salesforce backed ecosystem (pioneer of 10 Emerging Asia countries), which consists of data lake, enterprise data warehouses (GCP, Azure), APIs, Adobe Analytics platform, customer facing CRMs and built-in business intelligence, with >100 Billion row daily data refresh.
highlights: XGBoost customer segregation algorithm for performance marketing of omni-channel flagship campaigns media buy, social media and music platforms.
Training and testing support of a global YOLO-3-powered computer vision product for a rare disease, pioneering in the Asia Pacific (> 10 countries).

work.name: Pfizer - Emerging Asia and Hong Kong SAR, China
work.position: Graduate Trainee, Data Science and Analytics

work.name: Hutchison Ports - Global Headquarter, Hong Kong SAR, China
work.position: Environmental Management Analyst, Global Group Operations (Part-time)

work.name: The Project CR Team
work.summary:
The Project CR Team was formed on the belief that students can do more with their university in order to achieve sustainability. The main project is an initiation of a take-away box programme (currently named The Take-away Box Circular Programme) with the HKUST Sustainability Unit.

A pilot programme has been held between Feb and March 2018 on the HKUST Campus as proof-of-concept to the school. Over 400 users have registered for the programme with over 300 transactions within the 4 weeks. The programme was also covered by two local public medias, including Oriental Daily and RTHK. Our team has developed a proposal to HKUST to implement our created system within the school's management system. HKUST has since approved of our proposal and will be implementing a borrow-return system in Fall 2019.
highlights: Co-led operation logistics and a team of more than 20 students and staff to propose a new sustainable dinning blueprint to University management.

Oversaw marketing and user engagement function, including researches, event planning and management, business cooperation and cross-media exposure; championed business communication and partnerships with suppliers, non-profitable organizations, media and University bodies.
